chapter.title: Maintaining Fields and Depictions
chapter.para: depictionsequence The Fields menu allows you to load, save, check, delete and print fields in your depiction sequence.

sect2.title: Loading Normal fields into a depiction

listitem.para:
Choose FieldsLoad... or click the
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Load Fields dialog box appears.
Click the Normal tab.
The Load Normal Fields information appears. (see ) Load Fields - Normal
Select the Source for the field. (Unavailable sources are greyed out.) When you select External Depictions you can import &FPA; databases from another location.
Select the Model and Issue Time, if required.
Select Valid Time.
Select one or more Fields to load.
The Automatically select all fields in list preference highlights all fields available for a valid time.
Note: Some fields may not be available in every time.
Click Load to load the field(s).
If a depiction does not exist at the given target time and if the Ask permission before creating depiction checkbox is selected, the &FPA; prompts for permission to create the depiction.

If the field exists in the depiction sequence and if the Ask permission before overwriting fields checkbox is selected, the &FPA; prompts for permission to save the depiction before overwriting the field.
Click Close.

sect2.title: Loading Normal fields into a depiction at a different time
sect2.para: The target time is the valid time of the selected field. If you want to load fields into a depiction at a different time, use the Target Time area to select the target time.

To load fields into a depiction at a different time:
Choose FieldsLoad... or click the
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Load Fields dialog box appears.
Click the Normal tab.
The Load Normal Fields information appears.
In the Preferences area, select Show target time selection block.
The Target Time area appears in the dialog box. (see ) Load Fields - Target Time
Select the Source for the field.
Select the Model and Issue Time, if required.
Select Valid Time.
Select one or more Fields to load.
The Automatically select all fields in list preference highlights all fields available for a valid time.
Note: Some fields may not be available in every time.
Select the Target Time for the selected fields.
You can select an Existing Depiction or specify a new Target Time.
Click Load to load the field(s).
If a depiction does not exist at the given target time and if the Ask permission before creating depiction checkbox is selected, the &FPA; prompts for permission to create the depiction.
If the field exists in the depiction sequence and if the Ask permission before overwriting fields checkbox is selected, the &FPA; prompts for permission to save the depiction before overwriting the field.
Click Close.

sect2.title: Loading Daily fields into a time sequence
sect2.para: fielddaily Daily fields may display in multiple depictions if those depictions are within the time window of the daily field. See .

orderedlist.title: To load daily fields into your active time sequence:

listitem.para:
Choose FieldsLoad... or click the
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Load Fields dialog box appears.
Click the Daily tab.
The Load Daily Fields information appears. (see ) Load Fields - Daily
Select the Source for the field. Unavailable sources are greyed out.
Select the Model and Issue Time, if required.
Select Valid Time.
Select one or more Fields to load.
The Automatically select all fields in list preference highlights all fields available for a valid time.
Note: Some fields may not be available in every time.
If you wish to load the field in a target time other than the current depiction, select a different day in Target Time.
Click Load to load the field(s).
Click Close.

sect2.title: Loading Static fields into a time sequence
sect2.para: fieldstatic Static fields may appear in multiple depictions if those depictions are within the time window of the static field. See .

orderedlist.title: To load static fields into your active time sequence:

listitem.para:
Choose FieldsLoad... or click the
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Load Fields dialog box appears.
Click the Static tab.
The Load Static Fields information appears. (see ) Load Fields - Static
Select the Source for the field. Unavailable sources are greyed out.
Select the Model and Issue Time, if required.
Select one or more Fields to load.
Select Valid Time.
Set the Target Time.
sequence The static field is valid from this time until infinity, or until the next field of the same type in the sequence.
Click Load to load the field(s).
Click Close.

sect1.title: Creating fields
sect1.para: sequence You can create empty discrete, wind, line or point fields in your active time sequence.
Note: Daily and Static fields may display in multiple depictions if those depictions are within the time window of the daily field. See .

listitem.para: Choose FieldsCreate....
The Create Fields dialog box appears. (see ) Create Fields
Select the type of field to create.
A list of depiction fields appears.
Select a field.
Select the field valid time.
The valid time will default to the current depiction time. This can be changed as desired.
Click Create.
If the field already exists at this time, the &FPA; asks if you wish to replace it.
Click Close.

sect1.title: Updating fields
sect1.para:
You can update fields in your depictions. This has the same effect as the Load Field selection but is faster and more convenient if:
only the most recent issue time is required,
the field is loaded into the same time (no target time selection),
only a Normal field is required.

To update depiction fields:
Choose FieldsUpdate... or click the
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Depiction Field Update dialog box appears. (see ) Depiction Field Update dialog
From the drop-down menu, select a Field Source
Select the fields to update.
&colwidth2;
To select...Click...

all fields in one depiction the time (00, 12, 24, etc.) of depiction (the column header)

the office standard Select Office Standard
all fields Select All
&colwidth2;
To deselect...Click...

Click Update.
To see an explanation of the different colours, click Show Legend. Field Update Legend
Click Close.

sect1.title: Importing fields
sect1.para: Your System Administrator, can arrange for a computer process to generate metafiles for the &FPA;. A pop-up window will alert you when the metafiles are ready. When it is convenient to do so, you may import the new files using FieldsImport ....

sect1.title: Saving (and retrieving) depictions and fields
sect1.para:
You can choose to save the active depiction depictionactive sequence or time sequence or save all depictions and fields.
Choose FieldsSave Active or FieldsSave All.
To retrieve saved fields:
Choose FieldsLoad... or click the icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Load Fields dialog box appears. (see )
Click the tab for: Normal, Daily or Static fields.
Choose Backup as the Source.
Select a field. (see )

sect1.title: Deleting fields from a time sequence
sect1.para:
sequence To delete any fields in a sequence:
Choose FieldsDelete... or click the
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Delete Selection dialog box appears. (see ) Delete Depiction Fields - Normal
Select the Normal Fields tab.
Select the Normal field(s) to delete. &colwidth2;
To delete... Click...
a field the field box at the appropriate time
all fields in one depiction the time (00, 12, 24, etc.) of depiction (the column header)
a field in all depictions the field name (the row header)
all fields Select All
&colwidth2;
To deselect... Click...
a field the field box at the appropriate time again
all fields in one depiction the time (00, 12, 24, etc.) of depiction (the column header) again
a field in all depictions the field name (the row header) again
all fields Deselect All
Select the Daily/Static Fields tab.
Select the Daily and/or Static field(s) to delete.
Click OK to delete the selected Normal, Daily and Static fields.

sect1.title: Printing a depiction
sect1.para:
You can choose to print the map area (the active depiction depictionactive plus the static or daily fields with guidance showing) to an output destination such as a laser printer or file.
Choose FieldsPrint Active.
The Destination menu appears to the right.
Select the destination. The cursor turns into an hourglass until the printing is complete.

sect1.title: Checking the depiction status
sect1.para: You can display the status of your depictions' daily and static fields. A table indicates what Normal fields are contained in each depiction, as well as the Daily and Static fields at each time. Status of Depiction Fields

listitem.para: Choose FieldsStatus....
sequence The Status of Depiction Fields dialog box appears. Coloured boxes indicate existence of a field within a sequence. (see )
The colour describes the field's time link status. See .
To see an explanation of the different colours, click Show Legend. (see ) Depiction Status Legend
Click Close.

sect1.title: Viewing another depiction simultaneously
sect1.para: You can bring up another &FPA; display to view the workspace of another weather sequence using the CoView coview function of the &FPA;. All of the display options are available, but you cannot edit the depictions or fields in the other sequence.
Use this option to share your work with other &FPA; users.

listitem.para: Choose ActionsCoView.
A menu appears listing the available sequences to view.
Select a sequence from the list.
The &FPA; displays the other sequence. It may take some time to load the sequence.
coview Note: The CoView sequence refreshes every few minutes, which allows viewing changes made to the other &FPA; database in real time. Coview
